intro: Stylogyne oaxacana, commonly known as the Oaxaca stylogyne, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
